Looks like a problem with the class: com.cb.eclipse.folding.java.EnhancedJavaFoldingStructureProvider.initialize Perhaps it hasn't been updated to work with your version of Eclipse yet.
(Note that it is trying to use internal methods too...tsk tsk)
Please enter a bug report against the provider of the plug-in which includes that class.

bug.short_desc: [clean up] Source > Clean Up... preview of refactored source is incorrect

long_desc.thetext:
When using the Source > Clean Up... tool the "Refactored Source" preview pane is sometimes completely wrong. I shall attach a screen shot, since this is rather difficult to describe.
Luckily, the source refactoring is performed correctly, despite the corrupt preview.
Created an attachment (id=47124) Screen shot
*** Bug 154618 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This shouldn't happen anymore with bug 157798 fixed
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 157798 ***

bug.short_desc: Copy details action in Task List view should copy all selected tasks

long_desc.thetext: Copy details action in Task List view should copy all selected tasks. Currently it only copy the first task from the selected list.

bug.short_desc: [Project Sets] Export team project set lands in wrong project

long_desc.thetext:
I select some projects, then select Export... / Team Project Set. Then I push the Workspace... button. I select the file to be replaced as shown in the first screenshot (set-save-location.jpg). Then when i press OK, it picks the wrong project as shown in the second screenshot (export-team-project-set.jpg).
I understand in filing this report that i am supposed to select the destination FOLDER and not the destination FILE. When I do select the destination FOLDER, it works as expects. But the point is that if the dialog is going to let me select a destination FILE, then it should at least get the destination FOLDER correct.
Created an attachment (id=47125) selecting the destination file for the psf
Created an attachment (id=47126) then the wrong destination is shown
Please notice in the second screenshot that the Workspace radio button is selected, but it shows the worng project as the destination.

This has already been fixed in 3.2.1 and 3.3.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 141749 ***
Duplicate has already been verified - marking closed.

attachment.desc: selecting the destination file for the psf
then the wrong destination is shown

bug.short_desc: [DND] Drag&Drop requirement for DND.DROP_MOVE, not documented

long_desc.thetext:
If one takes the ultra-simple SWT DnD example at the address below, and modifies it to replace DND.DROP_MOVE, with any other DND constant (eg COPY, LINK), for both drag- source and target, drag and drop stops working.
Its not confined to this example; I came to it after days of struggle trying to get my plugins DnD functionality to work using DND.DROP_LINK.
http://www.java2s.com/Code/Java/SWT-JFace-Eclipse/SimpleDNDDragandDropExample.htm
Either: (a) There is a bug in Drag and Drop, where any source-target pair that doesnt have MOVE defined doesnt work. (b) There is a hole in the documentation, because if DND.DROP_MOVE is mandatory, it really ought to specify that somewhere.

bug.short_desc: pde.exportPlugins fails on long package and class names

long_desc.thetext: When I use the pde.exportPlugins task in my ant build script, it omits files and packages with long names. I tried a test with a package name of: here.is.an.extremely.really.very.very.longg.and.wordy.pakkage.name and a class name of: ThisCrazyClassHasOneAmazinglyAndRidiculouslyLongName and the plugin is simply not exported and no error or warning is issued. I have also seen the case where a long enough COMBINED fully-qualified class name causes the jar to be created, but the long .class file to simply be omitted from the jar. Again, no warning or error.
Andrew, dup of bug 69620?

Yes, I think this is a dup of bug 69620. I also noticed a few others coming in as dups of that same bug. Kinda makes ya think that it's not really fixed. There needs to be some sort of warning generated at the very least.

The problem I believe is in Ant. Does switching to a 1.5 vm fix this problem for you?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 69620 ***

bug.short_desc: Font display is inconsistent for Sheldon/Narrow font

long_desc.thetext:
I tried changing the Text Font to Sheldon and Sheldon Narrow (downloadable here: http://www.tobiasjung.net/profont/), which is supposed to be a proportional font. It displays correctly in the text editor, but it also displays what appears to be Courier New mixed in with it.
This appears in all text/source editors (XML, JSP, Java...).
My luck. First bug report and I have a typo. It should be "inconsistent", not "consistent".

Created an attachment (id=47127) Screenshot of display problems
Attached a screenshot of the display issue.
As an additional note, other fonts (even non-proportional fonts) appear to be displaying correctly. Just not Sheldon/Narrow.
Looks like there's a problem whenever bold style is used

Steps to Reproduce: Open library OpenUP_library_20060721 by epf-composer-1.0-M4-N20060728-1650-win32, export Library Configuration with default setting, many errors in problem view like: Could not resolve proxy 'uma://........' on model.xmi
The cuase is that the OpenUP library contains a dozen or so inconsistencies. We need to consider how to help fix those incocnistsency problems in any library.

Resolve it for QA to verify this as below:
For data inconsistency, EPF already have the tools for checking and fixing. 1. Use the Windows | Preferences | Method Auhtoring |Debug to enable internal debug tool, 2. use the Help | Diagnose and Repair tools to fix all the inconsistencies. 3. save the clean the library, and double check the library is clean. Finally repeat the test.

Resolve it for QA to verify this as below:
For data inconsistency, EPF already have the tools for checking and fixing. 1. Use the Windows | Preferences | Method Auhtoring |Debug to enable internal debug tool, 2. use the Help | Diagnose and Repair tools to fix all the inconsistencies. 3. save the clean the library, and double check the library is clean. Finally repeat the test.

After I do the following steps, 2 errors are still in Problem view. - Open OpenUP library (0818) - Windows->Preferences->Method Auhtoring->Debug, enable internal debug tool - Help->Diagnose and Repair Tools->Perform Helpth check on Library, health check successfully complete - Help->Diagnose and Repair Tools->Remove Reference to Invalid Object
Both 2 error messages are "Could not resolve proxy 'uma://........' on model.xmi", path is "OpenUP/openup_basic/capabilitypatterns/develop_solution".
The publish configuration successfully without more error.
Reopen this bug.

ed on Library 0825 with 0831-1150 EPF build, this bug is fixed. thanks.

bug.short_desc: NPE in Plugin.getStateLocation()

long_desc.thetext: NPE calling getStateLocation() in plugin activator constructor (org.eclipse.ui.plugin.AbstractUIPlugin)
Can you attach the stack trace so we can see the code path when the errors happens? Thanks.
Created an attachment (id=47133) the trace is attached

From the call stack it seems that NPE happens due to the "bundle" attribute of the Plugin not being initialized.
Most likely it happens as Plugin.getStateLocation() is called from the com.intel.ite.ide.IdeActivator constructor rather from the override of the start() method.
(The initialization of the "bundle" variable is done in the Plugin.start() method which is called by the framework later.)
The getStateLocation() along with most other methods on Plugin can't be successfully called from Ecilipse 3.0 - style constructor. Typically, plugins use overrides of the Plugin.start() method to perform the initialization.
Possible fixes in the user code: a) do Plugin method calls in the Plugin.start() rather then in the constructor or, better: b) consider using BundleActivator instead of Plugin The BundleActivator is much more lightweight solution what provides all the functionality.
On the runtime side, I think we need to document this behavior for future and provide a specific error message - something to the tune of "Inactive Plugin object was called. The call can only be done after Plugin is started and before Plugin is stopped".
I agree with the possible fixes in the user code, but it seems Plugin could check its state and return null object if it hasn't been initialized yet. NPE blocks loading the plugin.
Similar to bug 102879.

Yes, the bug 102879 has a description of the general problem. Not much can be done on the code side.
Returning null assumes that there is a fallback path in the user code which is not likely.
The only thing we can do is to add text similar to "Plugin APIs cannot be called from its constructor" to the Javadoc of the Plugin class.
(Adding it now to the migration guide will be couple years too late?)
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 102879 ***

bug.short_desc: https access for the web viewer in IE asks for security warning.

long_desc.thetext:
If web viewer is accessed using https, IE 6.0 displays a warning message
"This page contains both secure and nonsecure items. Would you like to display the nonsecure items ?"
Considering the large audience to which IE caters, the importance of security for business needs and to attract more BIRT users, the web viewer should be made https accessible. If not, guidelines to be mentioned if birt users themselves wish to do the same.

>the web viewer should be made https accessible. Sorry, What's ths meaning? I think web viewer doesn't care if you use http or https.
You means you don't want to get this warning message?

I agree that BIRT viewer is an web app, it doesn't matters if you access it via a http or https connection. You need to configure your appServer to support https connection.
Howver, we do need to check if the BIRT viewer hardcode any absolute URLs, i.e, start with http. All URLs point to BIRT viewer should be relative. THis may help avoid the warning messages.

The intension is to avoid getting the warning message.
yes, its right that the app server configuration file has to be modified for having https access. However as Wenbin He pointed out, there should be no items in the web viewer code which use absolute paths. Currently we have items in the code which might have absolute paths, hence the warning message. So, once the app server is configured to have https access, the warning message should NOT be received.
Please note that there are other items like frames/iframes which also cause this warning message.

BIRT viewer didn't hardcode any absolute URLs. For example: <BASE href="<%= request.getScheme( ) + "://" + request.getServerName( ) + ":"...> It didn't hardcode "http" protocol. I think it is due to the IE secure setting. If the page contains iframe or javascript, it will also throw this security warning message.For BIRT viewer, it is hard to avoid it.
Set all iframes src attribute with a temp blank.html. Avoid https secure warning message.Done test, it is fine now.

Hello Guys,
I recently downloaded the BIRT 2.2 package & installed the BIRT viewer. The bug status shows as resolved but I am still getting the warning message for the first time I hit the page to view the report.
I am using the Birt tag library to view the reports.

Hi Rohit,
If this issue only existed when using birt tag and worked well in web viewer, please report another bug for it. Thanks.

bug.short_desc: add a buddy list to ease task assignments and CCs

long_desc.thetext:
It would be nice in Mylar's Rich Client Bugzilla to have an address book for CC's. Often we work on projects with similar people and it would be nice to use previous queries to propose CCs. An address book of names to e-mail address might also be nice.
This bug report builds on Bug #141390.

We prototyped this way back and agree would definitely be useful and save us from having to type email addresses all the time. It's not a Bugzilla-specific thing since we would want it to work for all Task Repository Connectors capable of handling assignments and CCs.
I wonder if it can reuse ECF stuff. It already has buddy view and basic management features.

I looked into that with the same hope, and we could redistribute ECF plug-ins if not installed. Bringing Scott Lewis (ECF lead) into the conversation.
Scott: is ECF is reusable for these buddy list purposes? I installed everything from download.eclipse.org/technology/ecf/update and did not see the buddy list. Does it require the XMPP provider to be installed? As a first pass we would want only the most simple buddy list functionality: * A list of bydd names, where each name can correspond to one or more IDs (e.g. bugzilla login, Trac login) * The ability to group buddies

Hi Mic,
(In reply to comment #3) > I looked into that with the same hope, and we could redistribute ECF plug-ins > if not installed. Bringing Scott Lewis (ECF lead) into the conversation. > > Scott: is ECF is reusable for these buddy list purposes? I installed > everything from download.eclipse.org/technology/ecf/update and did not see the > buddy list. Does it require the XMPP provider to be installed?
XMPP yes...or some provider that supports the org.eclipse.ecf.presence API (Yahoo, XMPP, sametime, AIM in dev)
>As a first > pass we would want only the most simple buddy list functionality: > * A list of bydd names, where each name can correspond to one or more IDs (e.g. > bugzilla login, Trac login) > * The ability to group buddies
Could easily create such a provider to use bugzilla and/or trac logins. Just need to implement IContainer (org.eclipse.ecf.containerFactory extension point) and IPresenceContainer with something that gets buddy list info from trac and/or bugzilla logins.
Scott

Scott, I guess what Mik was referring to is the ability to have different communication protocols assigned to the same user identity.
That may also include information about email and other channels under the same user profile. So, Mylar could reuse profiles managed by ECF. The reason for that is that there are no info about user profiles avaialble trough in bugzilla and many other issue tracking systems, so it doesn't seem like bugzilla provider for ECF would make sense.

Hi Eugene,
(In reply to comment #5) > Scott, I guess what Mik was referring to is the ability to have different > communication protocols assigned to the same user identity.
ECF has an extension point org.eclipse.ecf.namespace...that allows providers to also define their own namespaces (for service identity, user identity, channel identity, etc). So it should be possible for an ECF protocol provider to create a user identity that would be mapped by the provider implementation to some protocol-specific identity.
> > That may also include information about email and other channels under the same > user profile. So, Mylar could reuse profiles managed by ECF. The reason for > that is that there are no info about user profiles avaialble trough in bugzilla > and many other issue tracking systems, so it doesn't seem like bugzilla > provider for ECF would make sense.
Where are you expecting to store and access the user profile information and what format? Is this available within Mylar or is it expected to be stored on the web somewhere, etc? In any case, a namespace could be created that associated with a given user ID all of this profile information (whatever it consists of) and associates it with a single user ID (i.e. instance of org.eclipse.ecf.identity.ID).
Scott

Scott, we sort of thought that ECF would provide some infrastructure to manage user profiles (add, edit, persist stuff shown in a Buddies view) and would allow to use/assign different protocols and other parameters to such profiles (sort of like an address book in your favorite email app).
It won't be convenient to have separate user profiles only because same person have multiple accounts in different im networks, and it probably won't make sense to implement dummy providers for ECF only to store profiles info.

Hi Eugene,
(In reply to comment #7) > Scott, we sort of thought that ECF would provide some infrastructure to manage > user profiles (add, edit, persist stuff shown in a Buddies view) and would > allow to use/assign different protocols and other parameters to such profiles > (sort of like an address book in your favorite email app).
Would be nice, but we (ECF) have sort of been hoping that Higgins would ultimately provide such a service (infrastructure for user profile info associated with user identity)...so we haven't tried to build such a service directly into ECF (but rather allow for such things via the namespace extension point).
> > It won't be convenient to have separate user profiles only because same person > have multiple accounts in different im networks, and it probably won't make > sense to implement dummy providers for ECF only to store profiles info.
ECF does store user login info in the preference store on a per-protocol basis (so that accounts can be automatically logged in when Eclipse starts up), but this isn't what you want as it just associates passwords with user ids.
Sorry we haven't focussed on this (user profiles to associate multiple identities over multiple protocols), but because of resource constraints we've had to focus on other areas.

It would be really weird to require dependency on another plugin just for that. We may not need ECF then, but it doesn't seem Higgins provide such stuff either.
http://spwiki.editme.com/Architecture http://spwiki.editme.com/Components

Hi Eugene,
(In reply to comment #9) > It would be really weird to require dependency on another plugin just for that.
Not sure what you mean...as the general issue of representing the 'user' and associated 'user profile' information in Eclipse is kind of a big deal (and fundamentally missing from Eclipse at this point)...along with any notion of authentication.
> We may not need ECF then, but it doesn't seem Higgins provide such stuff > either.
Sadly, no it doesn't as of yet. I had personally hoped for more sooner WRT user identity, login to Eclipse, and secure user profile storage/retrieval but it has been a real problem to get that done/in the runtime.

(In reply to comment #10) > > It would be really weird to require dependency on another plugin just for that. > Not sure what you mean...as the general issue of representing the 'user' and > associated 'user profile' information in Eclipse is kind of a big deal (and > fundamentally missing from Eclipse at this point)...along with any notion of > authentication.
It is just too much dependencies for such little value. All we need here is some simple infrastructure and ui to deal with basic user information (at least name and email) and in the future link that information to ECF providers, so we could build team groups around that (perhaps something similar to what Jazz has)

I really don't think it has to be that complicated (at first). Each time you add a CC, you add the e-mail address to a set. Then the CC field of the task manager can use the set for content assist. It might be nice to associate a nickname / name with the e-mail list so I can start typing "Mylar" and it could suggest beatmik, or mylar-inbox, or whatever I have associated with that nickname.
Of course in the long run these are all excellent suggestions. But so is support for importing / exporting address books, etc... A simple solution may be a great way to start. Once we use that for a few weeks I'm sure we could revisit the issue.

(In reply to comment #12) > I really don't think it has to be that complicated (at first). Each time you > add a CC, you add the e-mail address to a set. Then the CC field of the task > manager can use the set for content assist.
Well, completion has to get the data for proposals from somewhere. And the editor should have some place to save that data too. This is basically the infrastructure we been talking about and which which does not exist in any of the projects even related to this task.
> It might be nice to associate a > nickname / name with the e-mail list so I can start typing "Mylar" and it could > suggest beatmik, or mylar-inbox, or whatever I have associated with that > nickname. > Of course in the long run these are all excellent suggestions. But so is > support for importing / exporting address books, etc... A simple solution may > be a great way to start.
Here we are. You need to have aliases now, so it mean those aliases should be stored along with emails...

I recall now from the Higgins creation review that I was hoping they would provide some simple identity APIs of this sort. We should keep watching what progress they make. But I agree with Eugene that to get 80% of the value here is very simple, like Ian's UI suggestions, and I think that there are benefits to support a workspace-specific personal buddy list. Merging feedback here is what I propose we do:
1) Create a People list, where each Person object has a String handle and a list of one or more String IDs (i.e. connector user names). We can change the terminology to Buddies/Nickname if that's more common. 2) Avoid re-creating a Buddies view for the time being by putting a table called "People" on the Team page with a column for handle and one for IDs. Each entry will be editable. Since the number of user IDs varies this table entry can be comma-delimited. 3) Each time that the user manually enters an email address into the Add CC or Reassign fields a person will be added to the list. By default the part of their ID address before "@" will be the handle. 4) Each place that an email address shows up will allow "Create handle...". 4) The Add CC and Reassign fields will have contents assist that will present the list of people. 5) The list gets stored along with the rest of the task data in a file called people.xml, ensuring that it can be transferred between workspaces, gets the auto backup, etc.
This simple design will still allow us to interoperate with IM-provider lists via ECF when needed, e.g. by making their lists available to the content assist. Since neither Rob nor I can prioritize this any time soon I'm marking it 'helpwanted'.

(In reply to comment #14)
Good plan. Few comments though.
> 1) Create a People list, where each Person object has a String handle and a > list of one or more String IDs (i.e. connector user names). We can change the > terminology to Buddies/Nickname if that's more common. > 2) Avoid re-creating a Buddies view for the time being by putting a table > called "People" on the Team page with a column for handle and one for IDs. > Each entry will be editable. Since the number of user IDs varies this table > entry can be comma-delimited.
It seem that it should be like Map<String, Map<String, String>>, where 1st map is collection of handles and nested map represent a mappng between provider types/urls to handles/ids specific for those providers (email, xmpp, yahoo, aim, etc).
> 3) Each time that the user manually enters an email address into the Add CC or > Reassign fields a person will be added to the list. By default the part of > their ID address before "@" will be the handle.
BTW, it would be nice to redesign "add CC" part of the dialog. Maybe it could show list of registered cc's with links and have button that would bring a dialog to add/remove elements from that list. that dialog could use above data structure for completion. https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=152553
> This simple design will still allow us to interoperate with IM-provider lists > via ECF when needed, e.g. by making their lists available to the content > assist. Since neither Rob nor I can prioritize this any time soon I'm marking > it 'helpwanted'.
As I mentioned before, it should also allow to link Eclipse projects and/or repositories with handles.

I was wondering whether it should be that nested map and include provider/repository type. But then the user has to care about which email address is used by each task repository, and personally I keep the same ID for almost almost all my task repositories. In the extremely unlikely event of a a provider/email clash the user could just make a new handle for each person.
Agreed on the CC redesign, and on the linking of projects (bug 145214).

(In reply to comment #16) > I was wondering whether it should be that nested map and include > provider/repository type. But then the user has to care about which email > address is used by each task repository,
I think that would be taken care by Mylar. Repository is known when in the bug editor. And for manual editing you can allow to chose repository from the list.
> and personally I keep the same ID for > almost almost all my task repositories. In the extremely unlikely event of a a > provider/email clash the user could just make a new handle for each person.
Not all issue tracking systems are using emails, some using id's with whole variery of restrictions, so I have eu, euxx and ekuleshov in different jira repositories.
Same story with ECF providers. For instance, icq is using generated numeric id...
Chris, it seems like you are working on something similar for ECF...

yes, there will be discussion around this topic at the upcoming Equinox Summit.
Hacking up a solution for this is fairly easily, but I want it done in a good way.
No target when we expect to have an "address book" / "contact mapper" within ECF.
However, this is one of the great items that could be part of Mylyn/ECF integration (along with easy messaging of people from within the rich client)

(In reply to comment #19) > yes, there will be discussion around this topic at the upcoming Equinox Summit.
Cool
> Hacking up a solution for this is fairly easily, but I want it done in a good > way.
I always say, prototype first and architect later. :-)

Absolutely! It will also open other possibilities not only between these two projects.

bug.short_desc: consider increasing importance of bugs filed via Mylar

long_desc.thetext: Mylar's automatic duplicate detection provides a bug triager some confidence thata duplicate detection search has been perfromed, potentially increasing the signal/noise ratio of the bug and justifying reviewing it sooner.
No plans to do this now, since there is not a clear enough need to bias bugs filed with Mylar. Marking for later in case duplicate detection becomes reliable enough to warrant this.

bug.short_desc: Problem with install/uninstall on Eclipse 3.0.2

long_desc.thetext: 3.0.x is not supported anymore, does this happen with 3.2.x, too?

I work for WebSphere Everyplace Deployment for Windows and Linux Version 6.0 team and Eclipse 3.0.2 is our base.
Our DOU with IES 3.0.2 requires service until 4/30/09.
Also, we can't simply upgrade the eclipse version to 3.2.x.

Branko,
Our customer needs an update on this. Please provide an update on this.
Thanks.

Our customer has raised the PMR to a severity 2.
Can you please work with Praveen on this problem? He can provide more details if needed.
We do not have the option of moving to a later release of eclipse in our product. We have a support agreement in place for this version.

It will be really hard for us to debug a codebase three releases ago without a test case that demonstrates the problem. We need a simple test case with the smallest number of features that shows the hangs. Many things can be wrong here - specific features, install handlers in those features that cause race conditions, UI extensions in the new plug-ins that cause race conditions when activated etc.
Yes I agree. Praveen has been asked to come up with a specific test case for you.

bug.short_desc: Comparing profiling data

long_desc.thetext:
Is there a way(from within eclipse) in which I can compare the profile data of two runs. There could be several use cases like:- - I might have 2 implementations for the same task. I would want to profile and compare both so that I have a comparison sheet in figures and graphs.
- Machine configurations differ and I would like to know whats good for my appplication
And, how is the performance comparison on the eclipse 3.2 release page presented ?
Prince Singh Drishti Soft Solutions
Due to lack of resources this enhancement request is resolved as WONTFIX. Please feel free to reopen if you consider it's a required enhancement.
Changing to a more appropriate Product and Component. I am also reopening this because it was closed by mistake based on the old product and component.

bug.short_desc: Memory leak in Designer

(In reply to comment #2) > ReportXMLSourceEditorFormPage Line 120, 133; > Not fixed.
Fixed it as model team suggested.
(In reply to comment #3) > Will there be memory leak if this line > Object[] rtns = super.getChildren( library ); > throws exception?
Method 'super.getChildren( library )' does not throw exception, but for the sake of safty, put 'library.close()' to finally block.
Verified.

bug.short_desc: provide extension point for specifying issue tracker per-plugin

long_desc.thetext:
Now that we have the automated bug creation from the Error Log view, we could make the process easier by having each plug-in specify their bug/task/issue tracker. Something like:
<extension point="org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.repositoryBindings"> <bugTracker plugin="org.eclipse.ajdt.ui" repositoryKind="bugzilla" repositoryUrl="https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs" autocreate="true" <attribute name="Product" value="AJDT" name="Component" value="UI"/> </extension>
In orger to encourage user feedback any plug-in could specify their bug tracker association, and have it automatically created on first load.
How about non-plugins traces? For instance, it could use infor from Maven's pom to do the match from stack trace to issue tracking repository.

So you mean binding packages or classes to a repository? That seems doable too, and could be surfaced by a generic exception handler that would do something like spitting out a hyperlink for submitting the bug to the right component, etc. But create a new bug for that and specify there how you would want it to work.
Regarding "But create a new bug for that and specify there how you would want it to work. " can someone provide me with the new Bug number ? :)

(In reply to comment #3) > Regarding "But create a new bug for that and specify there how you would > want it to work. " can someone provide me with the new Bug number ? :)
I haven't created it.

No problem :) I was just asking because we are looking at it from an Eclipse point of view :) Not the report in itself by the idea of extension to the problem view and the message dialog framework to allow plugin provide to develop their own response to an error (send email, open web page, run tool .. or do nothing :)

Christophe: in Mylar we currently have a special status handler that we delegate to everywhere. It's role is to: 1) put an ISatuts message in the log 2) bring up a MessageDialog if requested (by a boolean "informUser" paramter) 3) trigger the automated error reporting if requested (see top of http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/doc/new.php)
It would be great if Platform provided some kind of AbstractStatusHandler mechanism, and we could register our custom bug repository aware handler instead of having a custom one. Shall we discuss here or is there a Platform bug report for this?

Mik, We are looking at different serviceability enhancements in Bug 154090. A 'common handler' is part of the theme to review the message/error framework I am pretty sure if you can give us your experience that would be great
Chris
We should have this for Europa, but there hasn't been demand to prioritize this for 1.0.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 150278 ***

bug.short_desc: Stop auto activation in comments and strings?

long_desc.thetext:
The user experience would be significantly improved if one could click a Do not activate in comments and strings check box in the content assist dialog box. Maybe it should not attempt to run the automatic activation in such cases anyway? Having eclipse sleep for a second or two every time I pause momentarily after typing ., : or > while in a comment or in a C/C++ string is extremely frustrating, so much so that I often just have to switch the feature off altogether.
Maybe its a core platform issue that also needs attention in Java?
This is closely related to BUG #126871
Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds > 20070115. Code completion is limited to the default partition now (=code).

bug.short_desc: read-only and write-enabled shortcuts

long_desc.thetext:
Sometimes it is not appropriate to allow shortcuts to modify the referenced elements. Therefore read-only shortcuts, which just display the referenced elements should be introduced.
The specification whether all shortcuts in a model are write-enabled or write-disabled should be made in the gmfgen properties (via a property like "Read-only shortcuts - true/false").
Updated target milestone
Since GMF 2.0 M6 was released April 5, 2007, doing a bulk move of all open Bugzillas currently on M6 to 2.0 M7. Owners will need to access if the issue really is targetted for 2.0 M7.
Moving to the next version.

bug.short_desc: [JUnit] Loading list of available UnitTests takes a long time

long_desc.thetext:
When I have a number of JUnit-Tests in my workspace, when I go to Run-Run... and select a test-case target that has "run a single test" selected and then press "Search" to search for an existing testcase, this search takes a long time, sometimes up to a few minutes.
This is tedious if you are e.g. manually re-testing a list of testcases that failed in an automated run, as you are always forced to wait a few minutes until you can run the next testcase. Maybe this information can be cached in the class-cache so that the search is done on available data.

bug.short_desc: Key can modify to empty string

long_desc.thetext:
When fixing bug 150579, I found this problem. Steps to produce: 1.Drag a table to layout; 2.On property editor page, select "Sorting" tab; 3.Click "Add" button, then an item is added; 4.Modify key column to empty string, and no exception is thrown. It menas that the key column of this item CAN be set to empty.
But in step 3, when adding a sortkey, if I modify the source code to set key property to be empty, then this item can NOT be added, and it throws an exception to tell me that the "key" can not be empty.
they're inconsistent.
Can you forbid to set empty string to key property or throw an exception when setting empty string.
The same problem occurs in the "Expression" column on page "Filter".

Model will throw out semantic exception when empty string sets to structure member which is value required. And it will break codes of UI and DTE. And should make sure all the behavior is right and continuous.
fix it.

bug.short_desc: Modifying a schema confuses the validation of an xml file

long_desc.thetext: Open an xml file in Source view which uses a valid schema. Validate the xml file, so that it fails to validate. Now modify the .xsd file so that the xml will validate without changing the xml file. Revalidate the xml file (right click on file name and Validate) - the file validates, but leaves the old error markers in the file. Note that the red x on the left hand side disappears, but the red underlined words in the xml text are still underlined, when they shouldn't be.
Can you add sample XML and XSD files with error messages and specific correction instructions?

I confirm this is still happening with WTP 3.0. While the error markers are removed after a manual validation, the right hand side annotations and squiggles are not removed until the user types something in the editor or does some other action to trigger the reconciler.
The the manual/build validation is a totally separate path from the as you type validation. While the manual/build validation is forced to use the changed schema, the as you type validator has no idea that the grammar has changed.
Nitin, is there a way to have the reconciler listen for changes in the referenced grammar? And I'm thinking this bug is more of an XML source editing bug and not an XML validation bug. Do you concur?
Yes, it's more a source validation problem than one for the underlying resources (which is also a problem in most cases).

bug.short_desc: [Wizards] autoraise of eclipse window is annoying

long_desc.thetext: It is not possible to control when the main window of Eclipse-SDK should raise itself or not. For example, if the user creates a new class, the "New Java Class" window appears and is raised to the top. That's OK. But the main Eclipse-SDK window is raised, too. That is annoying

PW
Can you explain what you mean by "autoraise"?

(In reply to comment #1) > I suspect that is your platform behaviour for model dialogs. > > PW >
I g uess, with "platform behaviour" you mean that this behaviour is defined outside of Eclipse for a wide variety of tools.
I looked in the KDE control center for settings that correspond to such behaviour but could not find it.
Ulrich

(In reply to comment #2) > Can you explain what you mean by "autoraise"? >
My meaning of 'autoraise' is: The window raises (i.e., hides other overlapping windows) itself without me giving a direct command / performing a raise action. An example for the latter would be clicking the outer frame of a window.
If I chose File > New > Class there is no need to raise the main Eclipse window. Just the "New Java Class" window sould be on top of all other windows.
Ulrich

bug.short_desc: Support boolean type in data set

long_desc.thetext: Support boolean type in data set. It'll cause some data transform issue with absence of boolean type.
Moved to 2.2 so we can address this in conjunction with ODA support of Boolean data type.
Per Linda Chan, the required ODA interface change (Bug 127234) will not happen before DTP 1.0 (Dec. 2006). Tenatively scheduling this to 2.2.0M3.
Bug 127234 is targeting for DtP 1.5, which will not happen in BIRT 2.2M4. Defer this bug to BIRT 2.2.0.

Added support in BIRT Data Engine odaconsumer layer to handle ODA boolean data type in result columns and scalar input/output parameters. It triggers calls to an underlying ODA driver that implements related ODA interface methods introduced in ODA 3.1 (see BZ 127234).
Support boolean type in DtE side.
verified and closed regards~
Closed.

bug.short_desc: [formatter] Source Formatter could not format chain-style method call correctly

long_desc.thetext:
Some libraries, such as builder classes in Apache Common-Lang project, use chain style method to simplify code, like following:
return new ToStringBuilder( this ) .append( "name", getName() ) .append( "category", getCategory() ) .append( "download", getDownloadUrl() ) .append( "detail", getDetailUrl() ) .append( "publisher", getPublisher() ) .append( "time", getPublishTime() ) .append( "users", getUsers() ) .toString();
In the code, each method call is on a new line. clearly as it is. But when using Eclipse JDT source editor to format this code, it is formatted into such an ugly like:
return new ToStringBuilder( this ).append( "name", getName() ).append( "category", getCategory() ).append( "download", getDownloadUrl() ) .append( "detail", getDetailUrl() ).append( "publisher", getPublisher() ).append( "time", getPublishTime() ).append( "seeds", getSeeds() ).append( "users", getUsers() ).toString();
I've studied options on Preferences -> Java -> Code Style -> Formatter page, but there seemed that nothing is used to determine whether you can put each chain-style method call on a new line.
I know that there may be questions about what means "chain-style". For example, the following code
getWorkbenchWindow().getActivePage().openEditor( ... )
This may be looked as a chain-style; but, as it isn't a very long statement, and could be filled in a single line, so this code can be formatted as normal.
There is a another way that I prefer: I enter some special markers in my code, and Eclipse source formatter could ignore formatting when it found these markers----Then I'm responsible for format the code by hand. e.g:
// @region(do-not-format) return new ToStringBuilder( this ) .append( "name", getName() ) .... // @end-region
Anyway, my wish is there should be some way to support chain-style coding.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 59891 ***

bug.short_desc: Problem with multiples JREs

long_desc.thetext: The problem it's hard to describe, and is generated when i uninstall JRE 1.5.0.06 and reinstall first JRE 1.4.2 and then 1.5.0.07. I have a run/debug configuration (a java applet, but i think that is not important) that references a project built with old 1.5.0.06 JRE. Then, i've modified the project for use JRE 1.4.2 instead of the default JRE (now is JRE 1.5.0.07). When i run the configuration, this match the old JRE 1.5.0.06 and not the project-specified JRE! In the panel the JRe name is correct, but when i launch the configuration, i receive an error that referes to the old JRE
Can you add screen shots of the JRE tab of your application, and the installed JRE's preference page?

Created an attachment (id=47201) Images describing the bug
See attachement images that explains better the problem i have found

(In reply to comment #1) > Can you add screen shots of the JRE tab of your application, and the installed > JRE's preference page?
I have posted the images: please note that the reference to old JVM 1.6.0.06 is only in the error message when i launch the configuration

Interesting. Can you attach the .launch file? The launch configuration is stored in a .launch file in the org.eclispe.debug.core metadata area. Or, you could use the "Common" tab to save the launch configuration in the workspace as a .launch file.

Created an attachment (id=47217) launch file for configuration
This is the launch file for the not-working configuration (using project specified JRE). See reference to old and uninstalled JRE! <stringAttribute key="org.eclipse.jdt.launching.VM_INSTALL_NAME" value="jre1.5.0_06"/>

OK, I see what's happenning... We changed the format of the JRE settings in 3.2, and this looks like a configuration from a 3.1.x workspace. So, it still specifies the deprecated attributs (VM type and name). There's a bug in that when old attributes are present, and the new attributes are not present (default), we revert to the old settings. We should erase old attributes when an old config is loaded.

(In reply to comment #6) > OK, I see what's happenning... We changed the format of the JRE settings in > 3.2, and this looks like a configuration from a 3.1.x workspace. So, it still > specifies the deprecated attributs (VM type and name). There's a bug in that > when old attributes are present, and the new attributes are not present > (default), we revert to the old settings. We should erase old attributes when > an old config is loaded.
It's true because the project was imported from a 3.1.2 project. But i'm almost sure that i have recreated from scratch the launch configuration... maybe the deprecated attributes are imported from project? Thanks in any case for explaination :)
Fixed. Updated JavaJRETab to erase old attributes when the user changs from 'old specific JRE' to 'default JRE'. Updated JREsComboBlock to handle the error conditions properly.
Please verify, Mike.
verified.

bug.short_desc: Newsgroups are empty / don't exist

long_desc.thetext:
While attempting to get access to the eclipse.platform.rcp newsgroup via the thread portal at http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/thread.php?group=eclipse.platform.rcp, I get "no such group".
When attempting to access news.eclipse.org directly using Thunderbird, I am able to connect to the newsgroup server, but any attempt to subscribe results in a single group called "eclipse" that cannot be subscribed to (Thunderbird ignores the subscription request with no error given). No other groups are available.
Attempting to use Eclipse Zone as a backup plan for access is also broken, as their email validation procedure is currently broken.
At this point, it would seem that all user support resources for Eclipse are off the air.

You may have a firewall/proxy issue, or something else. Our news server is working just fine, and eclipse.platform.rcp is alive and well at the URL you included. The registration also works, and I have received my username and password by mail.
Please confirm.

I too registered online, and got sent a username and password. first I tried it via the web portal and got this:
Eclipse NewsPortal eclipse.platform.rcp NewsgroupsWrite
Error:
Authentifikation at the Newsserver failed.
Error:
No such Group. 1
No articles available
I then tried to access the newsgroups, and was able to log in without error using the provided username and password, but no newsgroups were available in the subscription list, apart from a single group called "eclipse", which could not be subscribed to.
There is no firewall involved.

Ah. You mistyped the username and/or password. The silly web interface will require you to close your browser window(s) and try again.
Make sure you type the password correctly (or use copy/paste from the e-mail).
As for the single eclipse group in your newsreader, click the + sign, or otherwise expand the eclipse group. I can assure you there are 100+ groups in there just waiting for you to browse.
D.

Re-requesting the password, clearing private data (rather than closing 4 browser windows with 20 tabs each) and relogging in solved the web portal problem. Is this already a known bug in the portal?
If not I will add one - the portal should return 401 if the backend authentication fails, not 200.
Thunderbird is still very insistent - there are no newsgroups on news.eclipse.org, there is no + sign indicating that newsgroups are available below "eclipse".
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991

bug.short_desc: [projection] ProjectionViewer annotations should allow showing of rangeindication all the time

long_desc.thetext:
I have created a folding editor, and for each of the folding regions (ProjectionAnnotations), I have called "setRangeIndication(true);". When the editor is painted, the range indicator is drawn. However, moving the mouse across the line causes it to disappear as soon as the mouse leaves the ruler area. It appears that in ProjectionRulerColumn, the mouse move event sets the range indication to true/false based on the mouse move and redraws.
It would be nice if the setRangeIndication() method actually acted like a mode and was independent of the mouse move.

bug.short_desc: [CheatSheet] cheat sheets inconsistently follow into dialogs

long_desc.thetext:
the 'Cheat Sheet Content File XML Format' document states that cheat sheet items can have a boolean 'dialog' attribute. When 'dialog' is:
- false: the cheat sheet doesn't follow the user into dialogs that the user opens
- true: the cheat sheet (supposedly) follows the user into dialogs
Unfortunately the cheat sheet only follows the user into a dialog (appearing in a dialog 'tray' to the right) if the 'click to perform' link has triggered a dialog opening. If the user elects to open the dialog manually, the cheat sheet gets left behind (which is annoying with modal dialogs!).
It should be possible to use information from untriggered commands/actions specified in the cheat sheet item to listen for the dialog opening, and make the cheat sheet follow the user, even if they didn't use the 'click to perform' button.

Initially I had it jump into dialogs regardless of how they were opened, however we ran into many problems where if the user wanted to open some unrelated dialogs in the middle of a cheat sheet, it would jump into every dialog.
We would need to add a way to specify which dialog(s) the cheat sheet should follow, however that's a problem because at the moment there is no universal way to identify a particular dialog that could be considered API. This is the same problem as with scripting; there needs to be a way to refer to UI parts, and in order to be stable across releases that translates into making the UI API. I'm not sure at the moment how we're going to solve this.

> and in order to be stable across releases that translates into making the UI > API. I'm not sure at the moment how we're going to solve this.
Ah, ok. Sounds like a big job. Maybe the simplest thing to do is change the documentation to reflect the behaviour, until such time as the UI does become API... (or maybe you could have a wider help-system-part feature whereby there's a button that specifies whether or not help/cheatsheet parts should stay in the main workbench or follow the user around dialogs etc. I can imagine having the wider help system follow into dialogs might be useful... and might neatly complement the current dialog help buttons)

long_desc.thetext: I would be nice if PHP IDE could support syntax coloring for Smarty Templates (.tpl).

It would be nice in the beginning at least the Smarty tag to not be cosidered as "Invalid text string". There could be an optionto which extenstion to be applied smarty syntax highlight and may be autocomplete. Smarty has very limited amount of build-in tags so I think it should not be so hard to develop such a featute :)

bug.short_desc: Form Navigation should keep up with source page

long_desc.thetext:
With source page hyperlinking, it is now possible to navigate from a translated key (e.g. %provider-name) to that key in the properties file.
Such a functionality is not available in forms.
It would be good if fields denoting translatable attributes had a hyperlinked label that would take you to the corresponding key in the properties file.

Feature implemented.
Work Done:
* Detect and create a hyperlinked label on the "Extension Element Details" page in the plug-in manifest form editor for translatable attributes
-> When the hyperlink is activated, it opens the corresponding plugin properties file in an editor and highlights the matching translated key variable
- Functionality handled by new class TranslatableAttributeRow (child of ReferenceAttributeRow)
* Refactored and modularized ReferenceAttributeRow class hierarchy
-> Created new abstract child class ButtonAttributeRow using extracted button creation and action implementation code out of ReferenceAttributeRow
- Child classes adjusted accordingly: ClassAttributeRow, ResourceAttributeRow
* Augmented TranslationHyperLink class
-> Added extra error checking code
-> Added new data member that tracks whether the last hyperlink was opened successfully
* Implemented beep sound on failed opens of translatable attribute hyperlinks
-> Implemented beep sound on failed opens of class, resource and translatable hyperlinks if the plugin turns out to be a reference model
See attached Patch #1
Created an attachment (id=47565) Patch #1
Thanks Mike. Patch released.

bug.short_desc: Logic diagram shows RunAs DebugAs items in context menu

long_desc.thetext: Logic diagram context menu shows items irrelevant to the diagram, such as 'Run As', 'Debug As', 'Profile As', etc.
These Run On Server , Debug On Server show up on every popup. Do they come from WTP?

The Run As > menus come from the platform, and then the enablement/visibility of the various submenus (e.g. Run on Server) are based on the type of object that is selected. If you do not want Run As menu items to appear at all, then I think you need to make sure that the selection objects do not implement/adapt to ILaunchable from org.eclipse.core.debug.

Wouldn't that remove the editor-based contributions? The trouble is not removing the entire Run/Debug menus but removing the Run on Server, debug on Server.
I am still curious as to why Run on Server/Debug on Server are contributed so broadly to all editors (they seem to be on the editor contribution actions list).

The issue is a little bigger than just Run As / Debug As / Profile As
Other menu items are appearing: Validate Team -> Apply Patch.... (etc.) Compare with -> Replace With ->
These same menus appear on the shapes example in base GEF as well.

Created an attachment (id=49109) Patch that removes invalid contributed items.
This patch adds capability for clients to exclude items from their context menus ('filter'). By default, certain invalid entries have already been provided to be filtered (for example, 'Run as', 'Debug As', etc.)
Class affected: 1. org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.diagram.ui.providers.DiagramContextMenuProvider
Committed the patch .

attachment.desc: Patch that removes invalid contributed items.

bug.short_desc: [Content Assist] proposals for element names is too strict

long_desc.thetext:
1. Put cursor on the empty line between <plugin> and </plugin>. <plugin>
</plugin>
2. Invoke content assist. You get two proposals: extension and extension-point
3. Type e. The popup closes.
The current behaviour expects you to enter a '<' first. This is too restrictive. We should also continue matching on letters only. When the user chooses the proposal, we will insert the '<' suffix for them.

Created an attachment (id=47357) Patch #1
Fixed: Description of work to follow

Content assist for partially typed elements only worked for broken models (Model is broken by typing left angle bracket).
Implemented content assist for partially typed elements for unbroken models.
Handles two cases:
(1) Viewing proposals for elements partially typed before content assist session
(2) Partially typing element while in content assist session gradually filters proposals
Work Done:
* Implemented a mechanism to detect and manipulate "Content assist text"
-> "Content assist text" is any contiguous segment of text that can be construed as the beginning of a element document node prior to invoking content assist at the end of it or appended to the end of it while typing during content assist
-> Implemented in performance sensitive way
- 0 ms for parsing of content assist text
-> Content assist text is properly replaced by chosen proposal
-> Content assist session is preserved when typing backspaces
Thanks Mike. An excellent enhancement.

bug.short_desc: Logging

long_desc.thetext:
Establish a consistent approach for logging within Corona as well as recommended logging for 3rd party Corona plug-ins.
We have a several logging options: * workbench * equinox * platform * log4j * common base events
Since we have client side components and server side components as well as web service components it seems a compromise may be required. I would like log formats to be compatible so that can be combined (in time sequence) for analysis of problems that span client and server components. It would also be nice to take advantage of the native logging support in eclipse workbench and equinox since viewer are already available in eclipse IDE for them. The log4j option is appealing since we have web services that will initially be using the Apache Axis and log4j is available and stand alone log4j viewer are available. TPTP project defined common base events providing a common log record for log analyzers use.
The logging issue also touches issues such a trace, debug logging capabilities which I have found invaluable in client server environments. The ability to dynamically enable trace/debug type of logging can eliminate weeks of trying get the information for problem determination.
Finally, to completely inflame passions on this topic, should we tie our exception handling into the logging framework. How can we handle logging from non-Eclipse components that we use such as Apache Muse, Apache Axis which has several of their own logging packages?
Corona Logging details: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Corona_Logging

bug.short_desc: Situation reasoning scope not handled properly in import log filter

long_desc.thetext: Requires changes in both UI (GLAFilterHelper) and GLA Filter blade implementation.

This problem is due to the reasoning scope being an attribute of the base class SituationType. The user can filter on reasoning scope only without regard to the type of situation but the GLA filter blade implementation was assuming the reasoning scope filter would always be associated with a particular situation type. The GLA filter blade assumption is incorrect. We will change the filter blade implementation to accept a filter rule with path (situation, situationType, reasoningScope). The log import wizard code needs to generate this rule when a user selects Situation ReasoningScope for the CommonBaseEvent property.
Targetting this to 4.2.1 as it should be fixed to complete the fix for https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=138394.

bug.short_desc: RequiredDependency stops at the first unresolved

long_desc.thetext:
I have an eclipse 3.2 product
My Bundle is named: A The plugin.xml has the following (yes there is no Manifest)
<import plugin="org.eclipse.core.resources"/> <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.runtime"/> <import plugin="org.eclipse.debug.core"/>
If resources is not resolved, runtime and core BundleDescriptor from getRequiredBundles() will have no supplier evn though they exist
If now I reorder the xml and run -clean
<import plugin="org.eclipse.core.runtime"/> <import plugin="org.eclipse.debug.core"/> <import plugin="org.eclipse.core.resources"/>
the supplier for runtime and core will be found
It seems the 'requirement checking' stops at the first non resolved no ?

This is working as designed. The resolver stops at the first failure. Once a bundle is not resolved it cannot load any classes. There is no reason for us to continue resolving the remaining constraints on the bundle.

Can I transform it as a feature enhancement ? Ability to determine exactly which required bundles cannot be loaded and which one can ? This is for problem determination
Example: bundle a requires bundles 1,2,3,4,5 Bundle 2 and 4 are missing In our code today, I will get bundle 1 resolved, bundle 2,3,4,5 unresolved where I would 'LOVE' :) to see bundle 1,3,5 resolved 2,4 not resolved :)

Take a look at StateHelper.getUnsatisfiedLeaves(BundleDescription[])
This method should return all the unsatisfied constraints in a given set of bundles that have no possible supplier. Does this do what you need?

I forgot to mention. There are other reasons for a bundle to no be resolved. For example:
- Another singleton is selected (ResolverError.SINGLETON_SELECTION) - The Eclipse-PlatformFilter did not match (ResolverError.PLATFORM_FILTER) - The Required-ExecutionEnvironment did not match (ResolverError.MISSING_EXECUTION_ENVIRONMENT)
For these types of errors you should use State.getResolverErrors(BundleDescription) to get the list of ResolverErrors for a particular bundle.

bug.short_desc: Cannot run Test immediately after starting up secured AC

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Run setconfig.bat for AC (version 4.2.0.1). 2. Change the security enabled option to "true" by typing "true" when prompted 3. Accept all other defaults (including allowing "ANY" users) 4. Start the AC on the localhost 5. Start an Eclipse workbench 6. Create a plugin project or import one 7. Create a new TPTP automated test case for this plugin 8. Record a simple test case and add its invocation under the 'Behaviour' Tab 9. Select the automated test and select Run As > Test (or create a new launch configuration for it and Run) 10. Enter a valid localhost userid and password when prompted. 11. An org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException is thrown during the launch with the following output in the Command Prompt running the AC:
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl. java:85) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl. java:58) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAcces sorImpl.java(Compiled Code)) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java(Compiled Code)) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt endedImpl.executeCommand(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:157) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt endedImpl.run(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:289) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:570) Caused by: java.io.IOException: Socket closed at com.ibm.sslite.t.a(t.java(Compiled Code)) at com.ibm.sslite.b.write(b.java(Compiled Code)) at com.ibm.jsse.b.write(Unknown Source) at java.io.FilterOutputStream.write(FilterOutputStream.java(Compiled Cod e)) at java.io.FilterOutputStream.write(FilterOutputStream.java(Compiled Cod e)) at java.nio.channels.Channels$WritableByteChannelImpl.write(Channels.jav a:283) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.socket.SocketChannel. write(SocketChannel.java:180) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.communicator.ChannelC ommunicator.send(ChannelCommunicator.java:296) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.communicator.ChannelC ommunicator.receive(ChannelCommunicator.java:91) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.PutFileComman d$Server.execute(PutFileCommand.java:184) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.AbstractFileS erverCommand.execute(AbstractFileServerCommand.java:318)
Note: This will also occur if you create and run a TPTP JUnit test case but it does not happen when running a manual test case.
Note that this has been re-tested with AC 4.2.1 and TPTP 4.2.1 which both produce this error during TPTP AGR and JUnit execution as well as when running a TPTP manual test.
Changed severity to critical because later testing revealed more errors (see previous comment) and the work around is to turn off security which would not be suitable when security is depended upon.

This defect is caused by the client execution code (org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt endedImpl) since the socket is prematurely closed when executing a test with security enabled.
Please assign to the Platform.Execution component.
I have changed the component. Scott, could you please reassign this to Guru Nagarajan.
Liz, I cannot reproduce the problem. I can run JUnit test case successfully. Can you tell me what JDKs are you using on the Eclipse side and the RAC side?

I am using IBM 1.4.2 on both. Also, some other test cases resulted in failures and had this bug listed as the cause. They were in the Platform.Execution.ManualRunner.Windows_IA32 [manual] test suite and I am not sure who ran them but I will see if I can find out so you can reproduce the manual case as well.

I can reproduce the 54% hang with a JUnit test suite. Here are the steps to reproduce it:
1) Quit the workbench 2) Start the workbench again 3) Wait until the workbench comes up and start AC on command line with security on.
Here's the stack trace that I got:

at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(Unknown Sou rce) at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Unknown Source) at Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt endedImpl.run(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:289) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.loader.ScopedChannelClassLoader$Con sumer$ContextClassLoader.loadClass(ScopedChannelClassLoader.java:334) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.DetermineServ erReachCommand.<init>(DetermineServerReachCommand.java:218) ... 12 more java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt endedImpl.executeCommand(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:142) at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt endedImpl.run(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:289) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.InvalidFileSe rverCommandException at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.FileServerCom mandFactory.createFileServerCommand(FileServerCommandFactory.java:466) ... 7 more
I can successfully run this test when I start AC in secure mode BEFORE I start the workbench.

If you allow sufficient time between when the AC is started and the test suite is launched, then it will work. I believe the problem is that we don't give enough time for the AC to initialize before a test suite is launched. Maybe the AC can block any incoming requests until it has fully initialized or output a message that it has successfully started (we don't do that on windows).
So it ends up to be a startup timing issue. Do you agree that this can be looked at in 4.3 and a readme added to 4.2.1 instead?
Forgot to copy Ali. Do you agree this can be documented in 4.2.1 and revisited in 4.3?

The Agent Controller server port (10002) is a native port while the secured and file server ports (10003 and 10005) are Java ports. Port 10002 comes up quickest (since it is native code) and will start receiving incomming connection requests. The Java ports (10003 and 10005) will take a while to come up because it takes some time for the native code to create JVMs and load up the security and file service classes. If the Agent Controller is secured, any incomming connection will be rejected when trying to connect to 10002 and the client will be asked to reconnect to port 10003. Secured connection will fail if the time for the AC to create port 10003 is longer than the time for the client to connect to 10003. This will only happen if the AC is first started and then the workbench immediately trying to connect. This will not happen if the AC is already running (standalone or as a service).
The workaround is to check if those ports are available before trying to use the Agent Controller. The command to use on Windows is:
"netstat -a -p tcp"
The output should look like:
Active Connections
Proto Local Address Foreign Address State TCP neko:10002 neko:0 LISTENING TCP neko:10003 neko:0 LISTENING TCP neko:10005 neko:0 LISTENING TCP neko:10006 neko:0 LISTENING
Make sure port 10003 and 10005 are listening before connecting to the AC.
I think one of the bad side effects of launching a test suite before the AC is fully functional is that subsequent launches will all hang at 54%.
Liz is the reporter but my personal opinion is that it can be documented and re-visited in 4.3 timeframe.
I agree that as long as it is documented it can be pushed to 4.3.

bug.short_desc: @model features causes NullPointerException when specifying keyType and valueType

long_desc.thetext:
Created an attachment (id=47158) Patch to fix the problem
The problem is that for EReferences, the resolved key or value type must be an EClass and the resolve method has a guard to ensure it doesn't return an EDataType when resolving for an EReference. But in this case, the EReference is for an EMap and we need to be able to resolve to new EDataTypes for the key and value types. So I used the trick of passing in the container of the EReference, i.e., the EClass, and to resolve in that context instead.
The fix has been committed to CVS.

bug.short_desc: Disabled Text widget can gain focus

Bug #71765 might be related.

If you set the Text widget to .setEnabled(false) it will no longer gain focus. However, it will be greyed out on Windows platforms, but not on the Mac.

I believe that this the correct native behavior. I just verified that it has not changed since 3.1. Can you find a native application that does not allow focus in a read only text field? The idea is that you can select the text and copy and paste it.

I then tried to boil that done to the more general case of READ_ONLY Text controls and neglected to check their behaviour with Eclipse 3.1. Sorry about that.

bug.short_desc: ECore models need to support comments / descriptions

long_desc.thetext:
I'm entering EMF models by hand and I cannot see any way to add comments / descriptions to the ECore model nodes. (I tried adding EAnnotations but they caused the code generators to emit malformed Java).
In the big picture, EMF should allow the comments to be loaded from other sources and round-tripped to/from generated Java classes. But in short term, simply allowing comments to be recorded in the model nodes would be a GOOD THING.

An EAnnotation with source "http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/GenModel" and with a details entry with key="documentation" and value="your documentation" will produce Javadoc comments in the generated code. Here's an example from UML.ecore:
<eClassifiers xsi:type="ecore:EDataType" name="Integer" instanceClassName="int"> <eAnnotations source="http://www.eclipse.org/emf/2002/GenModel"> <details key="documentation" value="An integer is a primitive type representing integer values."/> </eAnnotations> </eClassifiers>
These are roundtripped via annotated Java (begin-model-doc/end-model-doc) and via XML Schema too (xsd:documentation)...

Ummm ... I didn't ask for a way to insert Java comments into the generated code. I asked for the ability to document an EMF model.
OK, your suggestion kind of works, but it is conceptually wrong to use GenModel sourced annotations as surrogates for model documentation. At the very least there should be an ECore sourced annotation type for doing this.

Steve,
I'm not sure I understand what good documentation is if it doesn't appear in the generated API, but, in any case, it seems to me that you definitely have the capability you need already. Whether you like the source URI we is use to indicate model documentation is not something we'll consider changing since EcoreUtil.getDocumentation/setDocumentation rely on this and so do many existing models. So you'll need to get over your conceptual wrongness concerns...

bug.short_desc: create editor tests harness

long_desc.thetext:
We have had too many regressions and back-and-forth on task editor bugs because we do not have unit tets for the editor. Making unit tets for an editor can be tricky, and the key is to focus on mocking up and testing very specific and minimal functionality n each test. Here's an approach for testing dirty state for tasks named via the task list: * expose a method for setting the description, which the task list cell modifier will use * open an editor on a mock task * set the description via a method * assert that it is not dirty
The write another test method: * open an editor on a mock task * set the description via a UI mockup, i.e. something that triggers the dirty state * assert that editor is dirty * save the editor * assert that editor is not dirty

bug.short_desc: org.eclipse.equinox.servlet.bridge.http.internal.ResourceRegistration doesn't handle If-Modified-Since

long_desc.thetext:
Currently, all resources such as html file or js files, are delivered on every request.
This is because handleRequest in org.eclipse.equinox.servlet.bridge.http.internal.ResourceRegistration doesn't set Last-Modified HTTP headers, and doesn't answer to If-Modified-Since requests.
Created an attachment (id=47165) Patch
Yes. Thank-you, it's been on the todo list for months. I'll take a better look tonight but this looks fine.

[submitted patch applied] I like this approach as it puts the onus on the URLConnection to give the modified date. This would allow a "special" HttpContext to override behaviour if it knows better.
One thing that came up in my testing was for bundleentry type URLs the modified date came from the actual file or jar entry. I wonder for these type of URLS if this really should be Bundle.getLastModified(). Any way... that's not directly related to this patch so I'll follow up elsewhere. Thanks again -- this patch is frankly neccesary for any production use.
The patch was written by Patrick Streule, so all credit is his. I simply recreated it against the latest version of the code and did the necessary administrivia to get it out there. Thanks Patrick!

A quick update on resource caching...
I've added ETag support consistent with what Tomcat 5 does. Basically we're generating a Weak Entity Tag from the content-length and last-modified-date of the underlying resource URL. What's different about this form of cache validation is that its an "identity" comparison vs. the date compare used for IMS validation.
In all cases we try to return both a Last-Modified and ETag Header however in practice the ETag should be used as HTTP 1.1 clients MUST send it. The IMS validation will still be used for HTTP 1.0 clients (that don't support the use of ETags) or if for whatever reason an If-None-Match Header is not sent and an IMS Header is.

bug.short_desc: [hotbug] Typing WSDL in Service definition field is very slow

long_desc.thetext:
Using the our product based on WTP 1.5.1 20060724, the service definition field on page 1 of the Web Services wizard responds very slowly when I start typing a URL. it seems to start processing as soon as http://<something> is typed even if <something> is not complete yet. It then seems to try and validate the URL after each key press. I also got a message box saying:
Operation timed out.
Could not retrieve the WSDL file http://www. Do you want to continue to wait for this file?
This is a regression from WTP 1.0.x. IBM would like to see this problem addressed in 1.5.1.

Andrew, thanks for looking at this. You might want to put a breakpoint on line 321 of ServerWizardWidget.java (inside objectModifyListener_) and see where it leads you. Somehow, fixes since WTP 1.0 have resulted in WSDL getting loaded each time objectModifyListener_ gets prodded by a keystroke in the WSDL entry field. We should not be loading the WSDL at all here. The catch is to find and disable this without damaging the WSDL loading and validation that does happen on the WSDLSelectionWidget.

Created an attachment (id=47229) Do not try to retrieve wsdl on each keystroke
Please give this patch a try!
*** Bug 152156 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Changed from [hotbug_request] to [hotbug], and lowered severity to major since the usage pattern is rare (free-typing a URL vs. using paste or browse) and there is a readily available workaround to the problem (ie. use paste or browse). Let me know if you disagree. We are working on a fix to this, possibly for next week's build, thought the imminent long weekend might delay that.

Created an attachment (id=47374) Validate after user stops typing for 1 second
This new patch reuses the timer code in WSDLSelectionWidget (WSDL selection dialog), which only kicks off validation after the user stops typing for 1 second.
Test was also done on the command that retrieves the wsdl from the Internet (by decreasing the timeout). On timeout, a dialog box pops up asking if the user wishes to wait. If yes, the command continues and the wsdl is loaded. If no, the command stops and the wsdl is considered invalid and next and finish buttons remain disabled. Users can re-try loading the wsdl if they re-type the uri.
No adverse effects was observed from the interaction of the delayed validation and the command timeout.
Over to Chris for review, thanks!

Hi Chris, I committed the changes for this defect. However, after committing these changes I discovered that there may be a problem in the Timer class itself. This is old code and was only used by the WSDLSelectionWidget. However, now this Timer code is being used in three places.(WSDLSelectionWidget, ClientWidget, and the ServerWidget) The Timer class has an evil static instance which may cause us problems now that there are three usages of it. I have asked Andrew to change the Timer code so that it doesn't use a static. This should make things cleaner. Therefore, please do not release this change until Andrew submits a new patch. Thanks.

Created an attachment (id=47589) fix for Timer code
This patch fixes the bug in the Timer code that was exposed by the first patch. This patch should be applied on top of the first patch.
Peter, please note the change is different than what we discussed about. During our discussion, we missed the fact that the instance is set to null right after the time expires. The means that a new Timer instance does get created on the next call to newInstance and we cannot simply reuse the same Timer.
Hi Chris, I have reviewed and committed Andrew's Timer code. These changes are now ready to be released. Thanks.
Released with tag v200608091548 for inclusion in the 8/11 WTP1.5.1 M-build.
Closed.
*** Bug 171206 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
