bug.short_desc: RFC: New Resources Landing page

long_desc.thetext:
Nathan and I have put together a new resources landing page. The basic idea is to put all the articles, books, code examples, screen cams, etc. into one convenient location. We're playing around a bit with presentation formats and would like your feedback. Does it work for you? Do you understand how to use the interface? What do we need to do before we move this to eclipse.org?
http://phoenix.eclipse.org/resources/resourcesn.php

I like the idea and have a few comments about the page.
Major: - It comes up fully loaded.
There is a looooooooooooooong list and a lot of other new navigation concepts that a user needs to understand (author cloud, filtering). But there is no description how this works.
I would prefer if the page would come up empty (or with the 5 recently updated/new resources) but with a search box at the top. One could search through all resource meta data and the matching resources would be displayed in the table. Perhaps the Eclipse search engine could be reused for that or your filter code.
Minor: - There should be a "mission statement" what this page is about. - The table looks a bit off from the general Eclipse.org design - The mouse cursor over the resource title should indicate click behavior (hand instead of text selection cursor) - Nicer type icons (or at least another color that does not clash with the Eclipse.org design)

(In reply to comment #1) > > I would prefer if the page would come up empty (or with the 5 recently > updated/new resources) but with a search box at the top. One could search > through all resource meta data and the matching resources would be displayed in > the table. Perhaps the Eclipse search engine could be reused for that or your > filter code.
What if we paged the list, so you only saw the first 10 items but could hit a next button to see other content?

My 2 cents: * I like it - more information, fewer pages. * I like the complete list at first, but filtering later would be ok * The type icons are cryptic * The dates are not as useful as how old this resource is; I'd suggest a smaller font date and a larger font "2 months ago" sort of thing. * That left menu (Committers, Newsgroups, Bugs, Articles) sure wastes a lot of space on the left as the list scrolls down - I suggest you get rid of it and use the whole horizontal space or find a way to use the white space under the menu for something (clouds? a legend for the cyptic icons?) * Should have a meta tag for the RSS feed so that readers auto-find the feed. * The Languages column is too wide (I see that it is the width of the "Languages" header - do we really need the header? wouldn't people just know that this is what the flags mean?) * December 1969, eh? Has Eclipse really been around that long? :-)

(In reply to comment #3)
> * December 1969, eh? Has Eclipse really been around that long? :-)
That was a test. No really. More seriously, I'm in the process of converting the book metadata and this is just an indicator that I'm not fully complete yet.

(In reply to comment #1) > I like the idea and have a few comments about the page. > > Major: > - It comes up fully loaded. > > There is a looooooooooooooong list and a lot of other new navigation concepts > that a user needs to understand (author cloud, filtering). But there is no > description how this works.
I thought of this. Frankly, if instructions are required, then the user interface needs work.
> I would prefer if the page would come up empty (or with the 5 recently > updated/new resources) but with a search box at the top. One could search > through all resource meta data and the matching resources would be displayed in > the table. Perhaps the Eclipse search engine could be reused for that or your > filter code.
I was trying to avoid the search in favour of the attempt at more directed narrowing concepts. But, I'll consider this a +1 for a search field.
> Minor: > - There should be a "mission statement" what this page is about.
k
> - The table looks a bit off from the general Eclipse.org design
A 'bit off' doesn't bother me. If it--in your opinion--flys in the face of the established Eclipse look (assuming that's a problem), then I'll try and work that out. Obviously, we've been trying to evolve the 'Eclipse' look somewhat...
> - The mouse cursor over the resource title should indicate click behavior (hand > instead of text selection cursor)
k
> - Nicer type icons (or at least another color that does not clash with the > Eclipse.org design)
You're a mean, mean man. I drew those icons myself. With my own hands. My own sweat (it's bloody hot here). I guess this is yet another indicator that I have absolutely no artistic talent. Sigh. I guess I should give up that spot on "America's Got Talent".
I'll see what I can do.

(In reply to comment #1)
> - Nicer type icons (or at least another color that does not clash with the > Eclipse.org design)
I snagged some icons from the Eclipse CVS (and had to make one). Better?

(In reply to comment #3)
> * The Languages column is too wide (I see that it is the width of the > "Languages" header - do we really need the header? wouldn't people just know > that this is what the flags mean?)
I took out the header.

(In reply to comment #3) > * The dates are not as useful as how old this resource is; I'd suggest a > smaller font date and a larger font "2 months ago" sort of thing.
I believe that Nathan was working on something along these lines. I'm going to defer this until he gets back from vacation.

(In reply to comment #3) > * That left menu (Committers, Newsgroups, Bugs, Articles) sure wastes a lot of > space on the left as the list scrolls down - I suggest you get rid of it and > use the whole horizontal space or find a way to use the white space under the > menu for something (clouds? a legend for the cyptic icons?)
I'm not sure how to accomplish this. I agree. Nathan knows a lot more about manipulating those CSS files than I do, so I'm going to defer this to him.

having the tag could count clicks would probably be in version 2 of this implementation. but i'll let wayne speak to that.

Number of articles.

I've made a change where only tags that have at least two resources connected to them are displayed in the cloud. I've done the same thing with authors.

bug.short_desc: support due dates

long_desc.thetext:
We currently allow tasks to be scheduled, which is the mechanism by which we know when we should work on a task and what to do next. However, these are 'soft' deadlines that often get deferred as higher priority items come in. But some tasks have a hard deadline (e.g. correspond to a calendar event or a deadline) and we need a mechanism for handling those via:
* An additional optional attribute on ITask for due dates. Due dates are inherently shared information so repository tasks should be able to handle them as well.
* When a due date is hit and the task is not completed something needs to happen. For example, a dialog could come up and clicking OK would activate the task, because at that point either the task needs to be done or it needs to be completed.
* Schedule For would still be used for setting a reminder before the deadline. So that both a Due Date and Scheduled For date do not need to be set we could have some UI sugar for automatically scheduling the task some amount of time before its due date (e.g. 1 day, 1 hour).

I think it is a good idea. More over those hard deadlines may come from remote issue tracker. JIRA has those due dates even in standard fields, in Bugzilla people usually using milestones to set the due dates nd those probably harder to match to actual dates.

Rob: go ahead with this one so that we can start getting a sense of how to surface it in the UI. I think that we now need to consider two kinds of dates: 1) Sharable: created, completed, due 2) Private: scheduled for
The thing with (1) is that if these dates come from the repository, we probably don't want to show them on the "Planning" editor, or at least make them non-editable. So it might make sense to pull (1) out into a separate section, or make them part of the planning editor's header, similar to the repository task editor's header.
Update: Task.setDueDate() Task.getDueDate() implemented/committed. Editor layout adjusted as per comment#2.

Mik, do you have an icon in mind for overdue tasks? I was thinking something along the lines of a little red bell. These tasks would always be visible in the tasklist (like tasks with incoming) so I'm not certain it requires a dialog.

Created an attachment (id=59611) date due icon
Agreed. Here is an icon for the editor.

Created an attachment (id=59612) overlay for Task List
I don't love this one, but use it for now. Put the decoration in the top-left.
Committed overlay code. Not sure the editor icon is necessary? Would it replace "Due:"?

Forget that icon for now, but you can leave it checked in since we might find a way of using it, and it helps the somewhat hard to understand icon that shows up in the Task List. Note: * The due date does not show up for repository tasks, but should. * I've lost the border for the editable summary of local tasks. * I think that the due date should go next to the scheduled date, otherwise it seems odd. I would shorten the labels on that line to read: Scheduled for: [date] X Due: [date] Estimated hours: [n] Active [n seconds] [refresh icon]
Done. Upon selection of New task text the text scrolls off widget to left and showSelection doesn't fix the problem. Not yet sure if this is a bug in swt or not.

bug.short_desc: Static method support should consult the exception list in the MF file

long_desc.thetext: The fact that the staticmethod support on the abstract configuration provider does not load classes in inactive plugins is causing providers to fail for some clients. The Static method support should have a Force Load flag so client who had his providers in the exceptions list in his plugin can use the static method support.

The problem is more pronounced when using the ContributionItemService. The only way to specify visibility criteria is through the xml. If the visibility criteria is complex, then typically static method is the way to go. However, if the plug-in isn't loaded, then the criteria won't be evaluated and hence the menu won't appear when it is supposed to.
a better way to handle this issue is to check if the class is in the exception list of the bundle (if the bundle was inactive) and load if it is true, other wise load only if the bundle is active.
Fixed

The original EJB project is not able to load its metadata or web services as a result.

On copy and paste of a web project in WTP, for example, all of the natures in that original web project, including the java nature and web nature are copied to the new project so that they are both sharing the same instance of the nature. The new project does get a new project info for the new name, but the data tree node and the element tree node from the workspace have the copy of the nature. This leads to confusing and errant behaviour. A new instance of the nature should be created for the new project.

Created an attachment (id=47501) JUnit test case
This simple JUnit test creates a java project and then copies it. It checks that the Java nature for both projects is the same (i.e., the failure case). The problem appears to be that the ProjectInfo is copied using a shallow copy and the natures list is the same for both projects in the workspace tree.
Thanks for the JUnit test, I can reproduce it. The nature instance should be nulled out in the destination project on copy. I assume you're looking for a 3.2.x stream fix for this?
Yeah, we need it for WTP 1.5.1 which I'm guessing is 3.2.1 based.
Created an attachment (id=47567) Patch against HEAD
Fix has been released in both 3.2.1 and 3.3 streams.

I verified this patch does resolve the original issue we were seeing in WTP regarding copy and paste of projects.
Thanks for the prompt response!
*** Bug 150295 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
It looks like this was never tagged for the 3.2.1 stream. I see the version in the maintennace stream but it is not tagged nor in for the 3.2.1 builds.
*** Bug 150295 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Unfortunately you are correct, the project was not tagged. Since we're done with 3.2.1, this will have to go into 3.2.2.

We have code in our 3.2.1 based product that programatically copies a J2EE project. If this fix is not going into 3.2.1 line, I would request information on how we can programatically do a work-around in our code to fix things up after (or before) our code invokes the copy operation.

The fix has been tagged for 3.2.1. This was my mistake, but in the future if you have a critical bug, prompt verification that the fix works for you would be greatly appreciated. This very nearly missed the boat for 3.2.1.
Verified this version is released now.

bug.short_desc: Support deployment of ODA Bundles in Web Application

long_desc.thetext: When deploying a WAR package embedded with the ODA runtime plugins on a web application, e.g. WebLogic 9, the Stop( Shutdown Platform ) and restart service fails to restart platform correctly. This is due to instances not being released when WebLogic is shutdown. So in subsequent startup, those classes and their static variables are not re-initialized. Any objects referenced by singleton instances, such as plugin extensions objects, are thus from the previous platform instance, and are no longer valid.
The ODA runtime singleton classes now release ODA singleton instances when the corresponding ODA bundles are stopped by OSGi.
Verified and closed.

bug.short_desc: [xpand] template polymorphism problem

long_desc.thetext:
i'm using 4.1.0.200607141551 from the update site, EMF-based UML2 with a profile that defines a stereotype "core::PlexxPackage" on uml::Package. the following template fails:
DEFINE Root FOR core::PlexxPackage EXPAND Package::Package FOR this ENDDEFINE
DEFINE Root FOR uml::Package IF core::PlexxPackage.isInstance(this) ERROR "oh oh" ENDIF ENDDEFINE
i think i shouldn't receive an "oh oh" message, but instead expand Package::Package.xpt, shouldn't i? the given example is invoked for the top-level model element, maybe that's the problem. changing the order in the template does not help.

i just gave it one more try and found out that it's the order of the metamodels as they are specified in the generator component in the workflow.
this does not work:
<component id="generator" class="org.openarchitectureware.xpand2.Generator"> <metaModel id="EcoreMM" class="org.openarchitectureware.type.emf.EmfMetaModel" metaModelPackage="org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EcorePackage"/> <metaModel id="UML2MM" class="org.openarchitectureware.uml2.UML2MetaModel" /> <metaModel id="coreMM" class="org.openarchitectureware.uml2.profile.ProfileMetaModel" profile="core.profile.uml" /> <expand value="templates::Root::Root FOR coreTestModel"/> <outlet> <path value="${srcGenPath}/"/> </outlet> </component>
this does: [putting the profile metamodel before the UML metamodel]
<component id="generator" class="org.openarchitectureware.xpand2.Generator"> <metaModel id="EcoreMM" class="org.openarchitectureware.type.emf.EmfMetaModel" metaModelPackage="org.eclipse.emf.ecore.EcorePackage"/> <metaModel id="coreMM" class="org.openarchitectureware.uml2.profile.ProfileMetaModel" profile="core.profile.uml" /> <metaModel id="UML2MM" class="org.openarchitectureware.uml2.UML2MetaModel" /> <expand value="templates::Root::Root FOR coreTestModel"/> <outlet> <path value="${srcGenPath}/"/> </outlet> </component>
is there anything we can do about that?
Are sure, that core::PlexxPackage stereotype really extends uml::Package? Could you provide the profile file (or a similar one)?

yes, core::PlexxPackage extends uml::Package, and that might also be part of the problem: the model root element is of course a uml::Model, which extends uml::Package.
i've sent the profile to your private email address (non-disclosure and stuff...)

The implementation askes the metamodel implementations in the configured order. If an implementation 'feels' responsible for an object (i.e. returns a type) it is considered the actual type, as along as the following metamodel implementations don't return a more specific type (i.e. a type that extends the actual type).
In your case the first implementation (Built-In Metamodel) returns 'Object' The second (EMF) returns null The third (UML2) returns 'uml::Model' which is a specialization of 'Object' The last (profile) returns 'core::PlexxPackage' which is *not* more special than 'uml::Model' as they are not assignable to each other (both just extend uml::Package)
So, I guess at least for the time being you have to know the described behaviour and configure your workflow appropriately. If you don't have any further suggestions I would like you to close this bug. I will add a respective paragraph to the expression documentation. Thanx!

so the problem is that an object can be an instance of multiple classifiers, in this case uml::Model and core::PlexxPackage, an on the meta-meta-model level, oaw::Object.getType() can only return one (the most specific) type.
what if oaw::Object.getTypes() would return both uml::Model and core::Package? in my case, that would solve the problem, since it would invoke the core::PlexxPackage template (the most specific that is defined). but if i had these templates
DEFINE Root FOR core::PlexxPackage ... ENDDEFINE
DEFINE Root FOR uml::Model ... ENDDEFINE
DEFINE Root FOR uml::Package ... ENDDEFINE
that would be ambigious. so returning multiple types would have no benefit. except that maybe a user could now define the preferred template to be evaluated by the order in the xpt file, and not through the order given in the workflow, which in my eyes would be more logical.
but anyway, i can live with a note in the documentation about the fact and close this bug. should we ever require an object to be an instance of multiple types, we can open a new enhancement request.

bug.short_desc: keep synchronize view view expanded for elements in the context

long_desc.thetext: To save repetitve expansion and Expand All clicks, it the expansion state of the Synchronize view could be maintained with the mechanism that we use in the Apply Mylar mode on the Navigator views.

bug.short_desc: Recursive Frameset being created by eclipse.org/uml2 web page

long_desc.thetext:
There is an annoyance which every web page author ought to avoid but isn't at your uml web page: http://www.eclipse.org/uml2/.
Find the following line and click on the link: To get started you can view the "Getting Started with UML2" article.
http://www.eclipse.org/uml2/docs/articles/Getting_Started_with_UML2/article.html page would be held within the frameset of http://www.eclipse.org.
Now, go all the way down the page to look for Conclusion section to look for the line: For more information on UML2, visit the home page or join the newsgroup.
Click on home page link .... Voila! The annoying phenomenon of recursive frameset within frameset where the parent frameset houses itself as a subordinate frameset. If I repeated the process, I might be able nominate the page as a candidate for web page obfuscation contest.

Created an attachment (id=47172) eclipse.org uml2 frameset recursion
This is how the browser looks like after a few clicks.
There are no frames in Phoenix anymore. The UML2 folks need to migrate to the new Phoenix codebase in order to get rid of their frames.
In progress, hope to be done this month.
Frames are gone. See new MDT site here: http://www.eclipse.org/modeling/mdt/?project=uml2-uml
The legacy UML2 website has been obsoleted by the new MDT website.

bug.short_desc: Compile errors in generated Java class _jet_transformation.java when a template has a compile error

long_desc.thetext: If a JET template is successfully compiled, and then subsequently has a compilation error introduced, then the generated Java class _jet_transformation has a compile error. The Java compiler error is fixed when the template successfully compiles.

Part of pre-compile 'clean' now includes removing the template from the project's list of known templates. This causes the _jet_transformation class to re-generate correctly if the compile causes a template error (and thus aborts code generation).
Changes committed to CVS.
Fixed in build 0.7.1 M200608030817
